Posts.Content: Jul 9, 2008 06:15PM sldgn72 wrote: Here for you some miracle survivor story. My extended uncle had colon ca , Drs had gave him 6-12 months to live at 1990. He had 3 years cemo treatm. non stop. Now he is about 80 years old very healty man. My friends mother had overian ca, had 3 months to live, drs. told nothing to do even no cemo nesessery, only radio at 1989. Now she is 65 years old and very healty. my drs one of patiants in my country, had diagnosed breast cancer with bone met, lived more than 20 years. She passed away , cause her old age. One of my friends , she is a nurse, had lung mets breast ca. doing very well for 8 years. When she diagnosed first time she was preagnant  and she tought, sshe would never growth her doughter. Now she helps her doughter homework. There is lots of story like above, I know all those people personally... If they can do, we can do easly, dont we sisters ?
Posts.Title: Im on the same boat also sldgn72 sldgn72

Posts.Content: sldgn72 wrote: hi, ladies  I just join this gourup. Iwas diagnosed 4 years ago with bc, and had already spread to my several  bones 1 years ago. I m currently on tamoxifen + lupron shots and zometa, But after last bone scans,and CT , my Onkolog decide to treat me with taxotore+xeleoda at least for 6 monts. Because my cancer cell is actived again. And they coused devoloped anemia on my blood. I fell bad pain again, and weakness.. New treatment will start in a week.. By the way we ve moved to US, Texas-Dallas, 6 months ago.from our country Im maried and have a gergous 6.5 years old only son. Sometimes I feel wory, but I know lots of the people who lives with the mets, long time, even I know lots of person who lives more than 15-17 years that, the doctors told them had limited time to live when they had first diagnosed with cancer,, Hope never over,, All the best for all of us, Sule  Log in to post a reply
